io.github.utk003.json.ooj

Class OOJParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.json.ooj.OOJParser

  • public class OOJParser
extends Object
    A parser for converting JSON into POJO classes from some form of Scanner or Scanner-accepted input format.

    This parser provides both recursive and non-recursive implementations for parsing JSON. However, non-recursive parsing is currently not implemented, and it throws an UnsupportedOperationException if called.

    For traditional tree-based parsing rather than class-based OOJ parsing, check out the io.github.utk003.json.traditional package.

    Version:
    February 23, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)
    See Also:
    Scanner, io.github.utk003.json.ooj

      • parseRecursive

        public <T> T parseRecursive(InputStream source,
                            Class<T> clazz)
                     throws IllegalAccessException,
                            InstantiationException,
                            InvocationTargetException,
                            NoSuchFieldException
        Parses JSON into an object of type T recursively from the given InputStream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the clazz argument and this method's return type
        Parameters:
        source - The input source for the JSON
        clazz - The class of the root of the JSON tree
        Returns:
        The parsed object of type T
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - If one arises while using Java reflection to parse the JSON
        InstantiationException - If one arises while using Java reflection to parse the JSON
        InvocationTargetException - If one arises while using Java reflection to parse the JSON
        NoSuchFieldException - If one arises while using Java reflection to parse the JSON
        See Also:
        JSONParser.parseRecursive(InputStream)

      • storeArrayTransformer

        public void storeArrayTransformer(Class<?> clazz,
                                  Class<?> methodHolder,
                                  String methodName,
                                  Class<?>... transformationParamTypes)
                           throws NoSuchMethodException
        Stores the specified JSON-array-to-class transformer.

        A transformer consists of the target class and the details necessary to locate the transformer method during runtime.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The target class
        methodHolder - The class where the transformer method is defined
        methodName - The method id for the transformer method
        transformationParamTypes - An array of the class types of the arguments of the transformer method
        Throws:
        NoSuchMethodException - If the specified transformer method cannot be found

      • removeArrayTransformer

        public void removeArrayTransformer(Class<?> clazz)
        Removes the specified JSON-array-to-class transformer.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The target class of the transformer to remove
        See Also:
        storeArrayTransformer(Class, Class, String, Class[])
